Nightshift pauses and gets into his robot mode, which appears more slender =
than before, due to his beast mode.  He looks to Lord Elder and cracks his =
knuckles.

" That just means we gotta do business old school style.  Could =
swing some serious recon out on the field and score the intel we need.  I c=
an reverb that back ta you guys, and you decide our next move based on what=
 I find.  Special ops is someth'n I've been trained in extensively.  And it=
 sounds like ya need a spy in your corner."

Don't be envious of what you d=
on't have, be grateful for things you already posses.  Nothing is worth mor=
e than family and friends.

On Nov 9, 2011, at 12:30 PM, Super Cyclonus <su=
percyclonus@...> wrote:

> > <OLD>
> >
> > Nightshift Gets down from =
his chair and paces in thought.
> >
> > " That means all the Primes got a h=
eavy burden on their backs. That old
> > dragon must've been a guardian of =
some sort, and knew that his land was in
> > trouble. But how did he know t=
hat he could entrust Tucson with his job?
> > How did he know that my pal w=
as so different than the others? And why
> > didn't Tucson get a piece of t=
he Matrix but has it's power? Is he gett'n
> > singled out for some reason?=
 "
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> LORD ELDER shook his head, "Who know why the Matrix chos=
e Tuscon or
> any of the other Primes for that matter?" ELDER said in thoug=
htful
> tones. "But you may already know that not all Primes have a shard o=
f
> the Matrix, like Optimus Primal. Then again there have been those who
>=
 never had the title Prime who carried the Matrix, like Ultra Magnus or
> e=
ven Alpha Trion."
> 
> He sighed, "It may just have been that the Matrix re=
alized that there
> was no Prime at the time and knew that there needed one=
."
> 
> Gesturing broadly again LORD ELDER continued shook his head, "But i=
s
> niether here nor there. In any case, I have explained to you at least
>=
 some of the history of the Earth, the last section is, that the
> Watchers=
 who were tasked with observing the Earth were now tasked with
> watching t=
he Minions - watching for any sign of Unicronian activity.
> We were based =
in the Antarctic in a tower called Cryonosis."
> 
> LORD ELDER frowned slig=
htly, "It is this base, which was connected to
> a satalite that we had in =
space that allowed us keep track of the
> Minions and even to a lesser exte=
nt the Predacons."
> 
> He looked up at POLAR CLAW, RAMULUS, WOLFGANG, PROW=
L and finally at
> NIGHTSHIFT, "What none of you may know is that recently =
we . . . I . .
> . have lost contact with the base and the satalite. We are=
 blind as to
> what is going on with the minions or anything else for that =
matter."
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
>

bot mode, which appears more slender than before, due to his beast mode. &n=
bsp;He looks to Lord Elder and cracks his knuckles.</div><div><br></div><di=
v>" That just means we gotta do business old school style.  Could swin=
g some serious recon out on the field and score the intel we need.  I =
can reverb that back ta you guys, and you decide our next move based on wha=
t I find.  Special ops is someth'n I've been trained in extensively. &=
nbsp;And it sounds like ya need a spy in your corner."<br><br>Don't be envi=
ous of what you don't have, be grateful for things you already posses. &nbs=

      <p>> <OLD><br>
><=
br>
> Nightshift Gets down from his chair and paces in thought.<br>
>=
<br>
> " That means all the Primes got a heavy burden on their backs.  T=
hat old<br>
> dragon must've been a guardian of some sort, and knew that=
 his land was in<br>
> trouble.  But how did he know that he could entru=
st Tucson with his job?<br>
> How did he know that my pal was so differe=
nt than the others?  And why<br>
> didn't Tucson get a piece of the Matr=
ix but has it's power?  Is he gett'n<br>
> singled out for some reason? =
 "<br>
<br>
<NEW><br>
<br>
LORD ELDER shook his head, "Who know why t=
he Matrix chose Tuscon or<br>
any of the other Primes for that matter?" ELD=
ER said in thoughtful<br>
tones. "But you may already know that not all Pri=
mes have a shard of<br>
the Matrix, like Optimus Primal. Then again there h=
ave been those who<br>
never had the title Prime who carried the Matrix, li=
ke Ultra Magnus or<br>
even Alpha Trion."<br>
<br>
He sighed, "It may just =
have been that the Matrix realized that there<br>
was no Prime at the time =
and knew that there needed one."<br>
<br>
Gesturing broadly again LORD ELDE=
R continued shook his head, "But is<br>
niether here nor there. In any case=
, I have explained to you at least<br>
some of the history of the Earth, th=
e last section is, that the<br>
Watchers who were tasked with observing the=
 Earth were now tasked with<br>
watching the Minions - watching for any sig=
n of Unicronian activity.<br>
We were based in the Antarctic in a tower cal=
led Cryonosis."<br>
<br>
LORD ELDER frowned slightly, "It is this base, whi=
ch was connected to<br>
a satalite that we had in space that allowed us kee=
p track of the<br>
Minions and even to a lesser extent the Predacons."<br>
=
<br>
He looked up at POLAR CLAW, RAMULUS, WOLFGANG, PROWL and finally at<br=
>
NIGHTSHIFT, "What none of you may know is that recently we . . . I . .<br=
>
. have lost contact with the base and the satalite. We are blind as to<br=
>
what is going on with the minions or anything else for that matter."<br>
=

(TAG)<br>
<br>
Preston<br>
